entry.title: SFC Alerts: MEXC Tiptoes on Thin Ice with Unlicensed Trading Platform
entry.summary: The Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) has issued a warning to the public regarding a purported virtual asset trading platform (VATP) operating under the name "MEXC." MEXC's Unauthorized Operations Highlight Regulatory Breach The SFC's caution comes amidst the active promotion of its services to Hong Kong investors, despite MEXC neither holding a license from the SFC nor initiating the process to obtain one for operating a VATP in Hong Kong. Operating a business of providing virtual asset services, such as running a virtual asset exchange, without proper licensing is a violation of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance. Furthermore, actively marketing such services to Hong Kong investors without authorization is considered unlawful. Asâ€¦

entry.title: Swiss Firm Launches Fully Backed Cardano Staking ETP
entry.summary:
On Thursday, March 14, Liqwid Finance, a Switzerland-based protocol, in collaboration with Issuance.Swiss AG, has officially launched a financial product named CASL, an Exchange Traded Product (ETP) that harnesses the growth and staking rewards of the ADA token from the Cardano blockchain. Listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange, CASL uniquely blends the stability of traditional finance with the novel returns of decentralized finance (DeFi).
Cardano Staking ETP Launches In Switzerland
The product is designed to not only track the performance of the ADA token, but also to capture the returns generated from staking ADA. This approach provides investors with a two-fold advantage: exposure to the price appreciation of ADA and additional staking rewards, thereby enhancing the overall return on invâ€¦

entry.title: US Senators Urge SEC: No More Crypto ETFs
entry.summary:
US Senators Jack Reed and Laphonza Butler have formally requested the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to reconsider its stance on the approval of further crypto exchange-traded products (ETPs), specifically targeting those beyond the realm of Bitcoin. This appeal, articulated in a letter to SEC Chairman Gary Gensler underscores the legislatorsâ€™ concerns over investor protections and the unique risks posed by the â€œvolatileâ€ crypto market.
US Senators Urge Gensler To Freeze Spot Crypto ETF Approvals
At the heart of the senatorsâ€™ concerns is the accessibility and sale of volatile cryptocurrency investments to the general public through brokerage and retirement accounts, facilitated by the SECâ€™s regulatory green light. â€œGiven the significant and unique risks posed by cryptocurrenâ€¦

entry.title: Massive Ethereum Laundering Operation: North Korean Hackers Exploit Tornado Cash For $12M
entry.summary:
In a recent development, North Korean hackers associated with the notorious Lazarus Group have exploited the coin-mixing service Tornado Cash to launder approximately $12 million worth of stolen Ethereum (ETH) within the past 24 hours.Â
The incident follows the theft of $100 million in cryptocurrency from the HTX crypto exchange and its HECO Bridge in November 2023, attributed to the Lazarus Group by blockchain analytics firm Elliptic and other experts.
$100M Crypto Heist And Ethereum Laundering Uncovered
The Lazarus Group, a well-known cybercrime organization believed to be backed by the North Korean regime, has a long history of conducting high-profile hacking campaigns.Â
According to Ellipticâ€™s latest crypto crime report, in November 2023, the notorious Lazarus Group allegedly oâ€¦

entry.title: Judge Rejects Craig Wrightâ€™s Claim To Be Satoshi, Dismisses Authorship Of Bitcoin Whitepaper
entry.summary:
In a significant development, UK Judge James Mellor has stated that Craig Wright, an Australian entrepreneur, is not Satoshi Nakamoto, the creator of Bitcoin. The verdict came after the conclusion of the Crypto Open Patent Alliance (COPA) trial, during which â€œoverwhelming evidenceâ€ was presented to debunk Wrightâ€™s claims.Â
Judge Mellor intends to draft a ruling that solidifies Wrightâ€™s lack of association with Bitcoinâ€™s inception, its whitepaperâ€™s authorship, and its technologyâ€™s development.
Cracks In Satoshi Nakamoto Story
The COPA trial, which delved into technical and circumstantial evidence, highlighted numerous reasons why Wright could not be considered Satoshi Nakamoto. The evidence presented by COPA not only discredited Wrightâ€™s assertions but also shed light on his alleged fâ€¦
